Profile

I'm an engineering research associate in the Poldrack Lab at Stanford University and an Adjunct Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. My research interests are in the development and analysis of statistical machine learning techniques motivated by, and applied to various modern big data problems. I am particularly interested in the analysis of large scale neuroimaging and genetics data. My CV is available here.

I will be joining the Department of Computer Science at the University of Illinois at Urbanaâ€“Champaign as an Assistant Professor in Fall 2016. I graduated from the University of Texas at Austin with a PhD in Electrical Engineering advised by Joydeep Ghosh. My postdoctoral research is primarily with Russell A. Poldrack and Pradeep Ravikumar.

  • Moved to Stanford! (Aug. 2014).
  • I co-organized the workshop on Divergence Methods for Probabilistic Inference (DMPI) at ICML 2014 with Jun Zhu, Mark Reid and Eric Xing (June 2014).
  • OHBM Trainee Award for "Exploratory Analysis of Imaging and Behavioral Phenotypes with Sparse CCA" (Mar. 2014).
  • UAI student paper award for "Constrained Bayesian Inference for Low Rank Multitask Learning" (July 2013).
  • Co-chair of the AAAI 2010 Symposium on Manifold Learning and its Applications with Richard Souvenir (Nov. 2010).
  • Qualcomm "Q" award of Excellence (pdf) (2006, 2007).
  • Outstanding NJIT NCE/ECE student award (2005).
